body: Could you try running the Capybara specs and see if those run on your system?

Something definitely missing on my system I'd say; output of "spec spec/driver/culerity_driver_spec.rb":

```
.....FFFFF

1)
NoMethodError in 'Capybara::Driver::Culerity#find with xpath selector should extract node texts'

/Users/wincent/trabajo/vendor/capybara/capybara.git/spec/drivers_spec.rb:69:

Finished in 7.088291 seconds

10 examples, 5 failures
(eval):1:in `initialize': can't convert String into Integer (TypeError)
```

Will keep digging and see if I can find out what.

Did a run of the full spec suite. In order to get that to run needed to install a few more gems (which should probably be added to the spec as development dependencies):
- sinatra
- firewatir
- safariwatir (not sure if this was needed or not but installed it anyway)
- rb-appscript

Here is the output from the full "spec spec" run:

```
(eval):1:in `initialize': can't convert String into Integer (TypeError)
```
I just reinstalled the Culerity gem and that gives me the same failures, then I remembered that I was running edge Culerity from GitHub, try installing that and see if it fixes your problems.

Yes, just installed it and it does indeed fix things.

There have hardly been any commits since the release of Culerity 0.2.3, and the only one which touches proxies is 4ee1726, so perhaps that's the important one.

Might be a good idea to update the README with instructions on how to use the HEAD version of Culerity. I guess there are multiple ways of doing it but I chose to clone the repo and build a gem from it:

```
git clone git://github.com/langalex/culerity.git culerity.git
cd culerity.git
git rev-parse --short HEAD #Â find out current HEAD: it's 218f631
vim VERSION.yml # bump version number to 0.2.3.218f631
rake gemspec
rake build
sudo gem install pkg/culerity-0.2.3.218f631.gem
```

So I bumped the version number from 0.2.3 to 0.2.3.218f631 so that when 0.2.4 is released it will supersede my intermediate version.

Cheers,
Wincent

BTW, have opened a ticket on the Culerity tracker noting this issue and requesting a new gem release:

http://github.com/langalex/culerity/issues#issue/10

issue.title: has_text? and invisible content

repository.name: capybara
repository.description: Acceptance test framework for web applications

issue.body:
Capybara master has a new `has_text?` matcher which excludes invisible content such as `<title>` elements and `display: none` elements.

Its implementation uses the `Node#text` method, so the implication is that the behaviour of `Node#text` has now changed from returning all text to only returning visible text. This presents two problems:
- Users will have trouble upgrading if they are using `Node#text` directly, or `has_content?` (which is now just an alias of `has_text?`)
- There is no API for getting e.g. the text of the `<title>` element. This could be a valid user requirement and was previously supported by the `#text` method.

I propose adding a `#visible_text` method and using that to implement `has_text?`, leaving the implementations of `#text` and `#has_content?` as they are in 1.1. (`#has_content?` can be deprecated but I believe `#text` remains useful for checking e.g. `<title>` text.) WDYT?

Related: #522

cc @mkdynamic

issue.title: Didn't change anything, but suddenly Chrome just hangs...

repository.name: capybara
repository.description: Acceptance test framework for web applications

issue.body:
Seriously, didn't change anything.  A few days ago tests were working fine, today, they don't.   (This is on a Mac).  (I wonder if it's due to a Chrome auto-upgrade?)

Anyway, switching to the experimental Chrome Driver 2 got chrome working again, sort of. 

Now this line doesn't work, presumably unimplemented in the new driver.
Capybara.current_session.driver.browser.manage.window.resize_to(width, height)

See trace below.

1) Any thoughts on where the problems might have come from?
2) Any thoughts on other workarounds or things to try, wrt the original problem?
3) Any other ways to set window size?

Thanks--
# 

```
 unimplemented command: setWindowSize (Selenium::WebDriver::Error::WebDriverError)
  /Users/tim/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p374/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.29.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/http/common.rb:66:in `create_response'
  /Users/tim/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p374/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.29.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/http/default.rb:66:in `request'
  /Users/tim/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p374/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.29.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/http/common.rb:40:in `call'
  /Users/tim/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p374/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.29.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/bridge.rb:615:in `raw_execute'
  /Users/tim/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p374/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.29.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/bridge.rb:593:in `execute'
  /Users/tim/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p374/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.29.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/bridge.rb:215:in `setWindowSize'
  /Users/tim/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p374/gems/selenium-webdriver-2.29.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/window.rb:78:in `resize_to'
  /Users/tim/dev-sge/testautomation/qa-harness/projects/inf_marketing/features/support/env.rb:73:in `Before'
```

issue.title: Unable to locate and click on image element with id

repository.name: capybara
repository.description: Acceptance test framework for web applications

issue.body: Hi there, I came across a blocker wherein i have to perform the click operation on an image (with an id), i tried xpath & css to locate this element and have failed to do it so far Snippet of the source in the web page: What was attempted and error thrown: (at option #3 - not sure how to avoid extra backspace "\" being added on the run?) Option #1: page.find(:xpath, ".//_[@id='j_idt60:j_idt61:pdo']").click -- Capybara::ElementNotFound: Unable to find xpath ".//_[@id='j_idt60:j_idt61:pdo']" Option #2: page.find(:xpath, ".//_[@id='j_idt60:j_idt61:pdo']").click -- Capybara::ElementNotFound: Unable to find xpath ".//_[@id='j_idt60:j_idt61:pdo']" Option #3: find(:css, '#j_idt60:j_idt61:pdo').click --Capybara::ElementNotFound: Unable to find css "#j_idt60\:j_idt61\:pdo" Option #4: find(:css, '#j_idt60:j_idt61:pdo').click --Selenium::WebDriver::Error::InvalidElementStateError: invalid element state: Failed to execute 'querySelectorAll' on 'Document': '#j_idt60:j_idt61:pdo' is not a valid selector. Can any one here share their thoughts on how to overcome this issue? Thanks in advance

issue.title: Multiple issues with Capybara 3.13.0+

repository.name: capybara
repository.description: Acceptance test framework for web applications

issue.body:
Using Chromium. After updating to 3.13.0 a bunch of our tests started failing. This also continued with 3.13.1 and 3.13.2. I waited hoping this would get fixed in 3.14.0 but it didn't so I opened the issue.

I'm seeing at least 2 different types of issues:

1) `.set` on an Element doesn't set the full text any more. For example I do `.set('main project')` but only `m` get's typed or any other substring of what I've written. This doesn't happen in 3.12.0. I think I've seen similar things before so I want to ask - is there any part of the code concerning writing text in fields in Capybara changed between 3.12.0 and 3.13.0? Do you have any idea what might be wrong?

2) Having code like:

```ruby
expect(page).to have_css('.fc-event', text: 'Test the calendars')
```

Fails with `expected to find css ".fc-event" but there were no matches` - which is obviously wrong as in the screenshot saved there are `.fc-event` elements just not with the correct text (the text is wrong due to issue number 1 above - it's something like `Test th`). The error is definitely wrong. Capybara does note when it finds elements when only the filters are not matched but it doesn't do it in this case which I guess is a bug.

There may be more problems, not sure yet. I would like to fix the first one and then see if everything is fine after that.
